question_sentence: Chinese researchers have cloned which monkey species widely used in medical research that closely resembles human physiology?
evidence: According to a newly published study, scientists successfully cloned a rhesus monkey for the first time ever using a technique similar to that used to clone Dolly the sheep in 1996. Experts say using cloned lab monkeys could speed up drug testing, as genetically identical animals give like-for-like results.

question_sentence: Which influential New Hampshire newspaper endorsed Nikki Haley in Tuesday's Republican primary in the state?
evidence: After decades of backing anti-establishment candidates including Ronald Reagan, Pat Buchanan and John McCain, the newspaper has been fiercely anti-Trump since the 2016 presidential election. In an editorial backing Haley last Saturday, the conservative paper said "it would be challenging to dream up a more solid résumé for a candidate to guide our country through the troubled world which we face".

question_sentence: Which country has been dubbed the "therapy capital of the world"?
evidence: Psychologists in the South American country are reportedly struggling to cope with demand, even though Aregentina has the world's highest number of psychologists per 100,000 people, at 222. By contrast, the US has 30 per 100,000, according to latest data from the World Health Organization.

question_sentence: Which of the following baseball players was not elected into the sport’s Hall of Fame this week?
evidence: Beltre, Helton and Mauer were electedintotheNational Baseball HallofFame onTuesday, getting 366 votes, 307 votes and 293 votes respectively, in ballots cast by 385 members of the Baseball Writers Association of America. But Wagner fell five votes short of the 75% threshold for enshrinement.

question_sentence: Reese Witherspoon's social media followers this week warned the Hollywood star against doing what?
evidence: The actor sparked concern by sharing a video of her "Chococinno" recipe, made from cold brew coffee, syrup and snow that she gathered from outside her home. For more tales of the absurd, subscribe to The Week's Tall Tales newsletter.

question_sentence: A robocall urging Democrats to skip the party's primary in New Hampshire used AI to fake the voice of who?
evidence: The New Hampshire attorney general's office said it was investigating what appeared to be an "unlawful attempt" at voter suppression, following reports of a robocall that used artificial intelligence to mimic the president's voice. The call urged Democrats not to go to the polls, and began with Biden's often-used phrase, "what a bunch of malarkey".

question_sentence: Which of the following films was not nominated for Worst Picture in this year's Razzies?
evidence: The action-comedy failed to make the Worst Picture shortlist at this year's Razzies parody award show, but the film's stars, Chris Evans and Ana de Armas, were both nominated for worst actor and worst actress respectively, as well as worst on-screen couple. Find out more with The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: The US Supreme Court this week ruled that border agents can remove what installed by state officials at the Mexico border?
evidence: Siding with the Biden administration against Texas Gov. Greg Abbott, the Supreme Court granted US Border Patrol agents permission to cut razor wire along the border. The ruling came after Texas sued the Department of Homeland Security in October, after border agents cut the concertina wire to help injured migrants who had reached US territory.

question_sentence: What is the name of the military exercise launched by Nato that is the biggest since the Cold War?
evidence: About 90,000 troops from 31 Nato allies and Sweden are participating in the operation, with drills to take place all over the region over the coming months. Nato's top military official has warned that the alliance must prepare for all-out war with Russia in the next 20 years.

question_sentence: A magnitude 7.1 earthquake struck which remote region of China?
evidence: The quake struck at around 2am local time on Tuesday in a remote part of the region, in western China, with the epicentre in a mountainous area 9,800ft above sea level.

question_sentence: A massive temple opened this week, drawing hundreds of thousands of visitors. Where is the temple located?
evidence: A vast Hindu temple opened in India on Monday. During the historic and controversial ceremony, an idol of Lord Ram — one of Hinduism’s most revered deities — was unveiled at the Ram Janmabhoomi Mandir.

question_sentence: The 2024 Oscar nominations were revealed this week. However, the Academy is receiving criticism for overlooking which movie in two key categories?
evidence: The summer blockbuster “Barbie” earned eight nods, including Ryan Gosling in the supporting actor category. But Gosling and many others are questioning the omission of his co-star Margot Robbie and director Greta Gerwig in their respective categories.

question_sentence: Which state conducted a Republican primary contest this week?
evidence: Former President Donald Trump won New Hampshire’s primary on Tuesday, defeating former South Carolina Gov. Nikki Haley. He’s the first non-incumbent GOP candidate in the modern era to win both the Iowa and New Hampshire Republican contests.

question_sentence: Which newspaper slashed more than 20% of its staff this week?
evidence: The Los Angeles Times cut at least 115 journalists as the paper confronts a “financial crisis.” The workforce reduction is set to be one of the most severe in the newspaper’s 142-year history.

question_sentence: Which fast food chain announced it is permanently closing one of its restaurants for the first time?
evidence: In-N-Out has never closed a location — until now. The chain announced its Oakland location will soon shutter its doors due to rampant crime in the California city.

question_sentence: Which comedian announced he will return to late-night TV next month?
evidence: After almost a decade, Jon Stewart will return to “The Daily Show” as a weekly host starting February 12. Some analysts say his return could impact the 2024 presidential race.

question_sentence: Which country recently launched a successful mission to the moon?
evidence: Japan’s “Moon Sniper” recently landed on the moon — but experienced an “anomaly” during descent and landed 55 meters from its lunar target, the space agency announced Thursday.

question_sentence: How many Boeing 737 Max 9 jets were grounded earlier this month following an incident in which part of an Alaska Airlines flight blew off in mid-air.
evidence: The FAA on Wednesday cleared the way for dozens of grounded 737 Max 9 planes to return to the air. Several airlines in recent weeks, especially Alaska and United, have faced hundreds of cancellations a day because of the grounding of the aircraft over safety concerns.

question_sentence: Which region of the US was pummeled by a month’s worth of rain within 3 days this week?
evidence: Up to seven inches of rainfall drenched parts of the South, prompting flash floods and widespread travel disruptions.

question_sentence: Which pop star is being sued for starting her concerts hours late?
evidence: Madonna is facing legal troubles for starting her shows more than fashionably late.

question_sentence: What time can Delaware restaurants and bars start serving alcohol according to the new law signed by Governor John Carney?
What is the name of the new limited-edition Oreo cookie that has been launched in 2024?
What is the name of the Delaware brewery that is opening a new brewhouse and taproom in Denver’s River North Arts District?
What is the name of the coalition formed by some 100 students, university leaders, and community members ahead of spring in response to the student protests at Delaware State University?
What caused the flooding in the lobby of Great Wolf Lodge in Perryville, Maryland?
Which two Delaware runners recently broke state records in Washington Heights?
What is the best time to book your Delaware beach vacation to save money?
How many hate crimes were reported in Delaware in 2022?
What is the name of the Wilmington apartment building for seniors and those with disabilities that was recently declared unfit by the city’s Department of Licenses and Inspections?
choices: Delaware Department of Housing and Urban Development

question_sentence: What is the reason for the flooding in Wilmington’s northeast area after Tropical Storm Ida in 2021?
choices: The Brandywine Creek overflowed due to a hurricane.
The Brandywine Creek overflowed due to tidewater and a quarry pit.
The Brandywine Creek overflowed due to a leaky roof
The Brandywine Creek overflowed due to a malfunctioning sprinkler system.
